info.title: Remoni API
info.description: The ReMoni API provides account related data and management options using HTTP requests. The API attempts to conform to the design principles of Representational State Transfer (REST) and is using JSON data format for request- and response payload. This document is intended for developers with basic REST knockledge

get.summary: Get all Accounts, ReadAccount permission required

parameters.name: orderby
parameters.description:
Sorts the result in ascending order by the supplied property.

Valid values are: AccountId (default), Name.

Note: orderby and orderbydesc are mutually exclusive.

parameters.name: orderbydesc
parameters.description:
Sorts the result in descending order by the supplied property.

Valid values are: AccountId (default), Name.

Note: orderby and orderbydesc are mutually exclusive.

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: Query paging Returns the maximum number of entities. Default and max value is 10000

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Query paging Skips this number of entities

Link.description: Provides links to current, previous and next for Paged Responses. See the Query Options menu for more details.

X-Total-Count.description: A Paged Response might only include some of the records. This provides the total number of records that exists.

get.summary: Get Data by AggregateType, UnitId and Timestamp
get.description: It is required to filter by UnitId, AggregateType and at least one Timestamp. It's possible to filter by multiple timestamps to filter by a date range.

parameters.name: orderby
parameters.description:
Sorts the result in ascending order by the supplied property.

Valid values are: Timestamp (default).

Note: orderby and orderbydesc are mutually exclusive.

parameters.name: orderbydesc
parameters.description:
Sorts the result in descending order by the supplied property.

Valid values are: Timestamp (default).

Note: orderby and orderbydesc are mutually exclusive.

parameters.name: Timestamp
parameters.description:
Filters the result by Timestamp using the supplied operation and value.

Valid operations are: eq(datetime), ge(datetime), gt(datetime), le(datetime), lt(datetime)

parameters.name: UnitId
parameters.description:
Filters the result by UnitId using the supplied operation and value.

Valid operations are: eq(int)

parameters.name: AggregateType
parameters.description:
Filters the result by AggregateType using the supplied operation and value.

Valid operations are: eq(aggregatetype)

aggregatetype = ['Raw', 'Minutes5', 'Hour', 'Day']

post.summary:
Request a password reset. An email will be sent to the user, with instructions on how to reset his password.
Should be used both when then user has forgotten his password and need to pick a new one, and when the user
is newly invited, and the link in the invitation email has expired (or the email is lost)

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: The email of the user

post.summary: Request reset email. A verification email will be sent to the new email.

parameters.name: dto
parameters.description: The users' new email

post.summary: Complete registration of a new user

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: The email of the user

parameters.name: dto
parameters.description: The users' secret token, new name and new password

post.summary: Set a new password for a user, using a previously requested token (sent to user by email)

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: The email of the user

parameters.name: dto
parameters.description: The users' secret token and new password

parameters.name: dto
parameters.description: The users' secret token

PropertyValueErrors.Message: The property Account.AccountId has an invalid value

ArrayPropertyValueErrors.Message: The property entity does not exist or you don't have permissions to refer it

example.Message: You are not authorized to access this ressource
The ressource cannot be found or is not accesible for the authenticated user

basic.description: All requests performed against the public API must contain an Authorization http header, with a valid value to be authenticated. A valid Authorization header value is 'basic' followed by a single space, and then the base 64 encoded email and password separated with a colon E.g. Authorization: basic dXNlcm5hbWU6cGFzc3dvcmQ=
